definition: disgraceful (of behavior that is unfilial, rebellious or otherwise in grave breach of the norms of society)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
contrary/opposite/backwards/to go against/to oppose/to betray/to rebel

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)

sentences.english: Because doing so would be considered outrageous, that would be political suicide.
sentences.chinese: 因爲這麼做會被認爲大逆不道，那會是政治自殺。

sentences.english: What 18-year-old hasn't done something profoundly stupid?
sentences.chinese: 18歲沒有做什麼大逆不道的事情。

definition: rebels and traitors (idiom)/general term for scoundrel
to disrespect one's superiors/to offend one's elders
to execute all of sb's relatives (as punishment) (old)
worse than a beast/to behave immorally
